document.title: DOE College and Career Readiness Standards

82FAFAB77D2D4EACBA6348359E33BBA5.description: Use context to confirm or self-correct word recognition and understanding, rereading as necessary.

200576BE784540F7A3B3A70652F21DDD.description: Read grade-level text orally with accuracy, appropriate rate, and expression on successive readings.

48FF3E1578B8467587FE6D3444C19930.description: Read grade-level text with purpose and understanding.

9AA7035E2394452580F6878F44B9D39C.description: Read with sufficient accuracy and fluency to support comprehension.

74B14A028D3F46D7815D43F5F8FA21F2.description: Read with sufficient accuracy and fluency to support comprehension. (Fluency)

A094E494988248288E84478A675496CC.description: Recognize and read grade-appropriate irregularly spelled words. (RF.K.3 and 1.3 merge)

90C5CAFC5AEB4968B6D3E837CC286840.description:
Read common high-frequency words by sight
(e.g., the, of, to, you, she, my, is, are, do, does).

F49AF2515B1247C690C987A8F7B2B8E0.description: Decode two-syllable words following basic patterns by breaking the words into syllables.

610FF3DD72A547AFAA5838EAE6B1E935.description: Use knowledge that every syllable must have a vowel sound to determine the number of syllables in a printed word.

5CAACE1D412B4A28BE48ACBF7C8029C4.description: Know final -e and common vowel team conventions for representing long vowel sounds.

DE22D4482AC44DDB86F41D9913DF372B.description: Distinguish between similarly spelled words by identifying the sounds of the letters that differ.

285C0A2540FC48FD9A1FF22CF85211FF.description: Know the spelling-sound correspondences for common consonant digraphs.

958B001904474CB2997E92F0286ABECE.description: Associate the long and short sounds with common spellings (graphemes) for the five major vowels.

333E79A8A7B44F089EC6216E8E11EB77.description: Demonstrate basic knowledge of one-to-one letter- sound correspondences by producing the primary sound or many of the most frequent sounds for each consonant.

BB4936F516AF49F09B6660C9B979260D.description: Know and apply grade-level phonics and word analysis skills in decoding words.

B29C68D0003B4CD8B0126F0C1A570A3F.description: Know and apply grade-level phonics and word analysis skills in decoding words. (Phonics and Word Recognition)

6528382DEDD94B7EBC89F83C61FD769B.description: Add or substitute individual sounds (phonemes) in simple, one-syllable words to make new words.

9DD0D36D44C04B94A905F8002DD208EB.description: Isolate and pronounce initial, medial vowel, and final sounds (phonemes) in spoken single-syllable words.

244244EF9A7D4BB4A1C2438DFF27497A.description: Segment spoken single-syllable words into their complete sequence of individual sounds (phonemes).

385FFE9C8AAF4B5BB18B89C88F5FBCD1.description: Orally produce single-syllable words by blending sounds (phonemes), including consonant blends.

B5A69810E9334289B0365054A71A2248.description: Blend and segment onsets and rimes of single- syllable spoken words.

9DFD61246C5247B48C72CB571264426B.description: Count, pronounce, blend, and segment syllables in spoken words.

2678702B90D6416F9B19E63ED397F17F.description: Distinguish long from short vowel sounds in spoken single-syllable words.

A5D3AA93F9924924B9E0CF504FBD1233.description: Demonstrate understanding of spoken words, syllables, and sounds (phonemes).

7323B76B83764B1F85C61C3DB60E2A33.description: Demonstrate understanding of spoken words, syllables, and sounds (phonemes). (Phonological Awareness)

50B4AE15562F49B3BD7694902CE5C84D.description: Use words and phrases acquired through conversations, reading and being read to, and responding to texts, including using frequently occurring conjunctions to signal simple relationships (e.g., because).

F03E16953E3B4CC5B61F9A3982EAFE1A.description:
CCR Anchor 6: Acquire and use accurately a range of general academic and domain-specific words and phrases sufficient for reading, writing, speaking, and listening at the college and career readiness level; demonstrate independence in gathering vocabulary knowledge when encountering a word or phrase important
to comprehension or expression.

5CB08103D871430A93DC980A81C9E53E.description: Distinguish shades of meaning among verbs differing in manner (e.g., look, peek, glance, stare, glare, scowl) and adjectives differing in intensity (e.g., large, gigantic) by defining or choosing them or by acting out the meanings.

573A0060F1694EBAB0C75973DAB31D82.description: Identify real-life connections between words and their use (e.g., note places at home that are cozy).

BE70F3D142E447E7A0775E13E521E1F0.description: Define words by category and by one or more key attributes (e.g., a duck is a bird that swims; a tiger is a large cat with stripes).

91C87190BFA44C6BB0ED696EEC7EC1D7.description: Sort words into categories (e.g., colors, clothing) to gain a sense of the concepts the categories represent.

CF35656E98214C878D11C5A73A6AA8F5.description: With guidance and support, demonstrate understanding of word relationships and nuances in word meanings.

4BE709FE5D8E4AF8B1F26FE4FC6769D3.description: CCR Anchor 5: Demonstrate understanding of figurative language, word relationships, and nuances in word meanings.

A1C51FEE9F454614BC2DA56EAA1EB85A.description: Identify frequently occurring root words (e.g., look) and their inflectional forms (e.g., looks, looked, looking).

C06AA19AA2A54FA1BF095500ECDEFCC5.description: Use frequently occurring affixes as a clue to the meaning of a word.

5DF9C9E3F96D4F4CA8CAE6D6B141437D.description: Use sentence-level context as a clue to the meaning of a word or phrase.

72E7930BA64F44C097BD3A0DD08863E9.description: Determine or clarify the meaning of unknown and multiple-meaning words and phrases, choosing flexibly from an array of strategies.

006CC5C6BDFA42A595172CFB9C0E1D4C.description:
CCR Anchor 4: Determine or clarify the meaning of unknown and multiple-meaning words and phrases by using context clues, analyzing meaningful word parts,
 
 
and consulting general and specialized reference materials, as appropriate.

6257E64DB8AF437CAC155D0D21BBBEFC.description: Spell untaught words phonetically, drawing on phonemic awareness and spelling conventions.

0D1D612F0C3A4011AF1CD2264C13EA7C.description: Use conventional spelling for words with common spelling patterns and for frequently occurring irregular words.

DCE4C974AFDC44B6A5AF08715AC6B606.description: Spell simple words phonetically, drawing on knowledge of sound-letter relationships.

2D18F7AA1F024E4DB6948828FB06919C.description: Write a letter or letters for most consonant and short- vowel sounds (phonemes).

62D0A61201FD40838996548C1F459547.description: Use commas in dates and to separate single words in a series.

D6CBECD1FC92405D93C962A656D3AED8.description: Capitalize dates and names of people.

31BEA8F7F6604688A3C0A8A8B83DA1CB.description: Capitalize the first word in a sentence and the pronoun I.

5B1D5114AB5E4D4EADA9025D7A3C31EA.description: Demonstrate command of the conventions of standard English capitalization, punctuation, and spelling when writing.

CA2C727D60E44FBBABEA6937EF43316A.description: CCR Anchor 2: Demonstrate command of the conventions of standard English capitalization, punctuation, and spelling when writing.

D8E3E02E08274A37AF9CADACBE62996F.description: Produce and expand complete simple and compound declarative, interrogative, imperative, and exclamatory sentences in response to prompts. (L.K.1 and 1.1 merge)

D4A2A3F1E24D4688A728FF56796542F9.description:
Understand and use question words
(interrogatives) (e.g., who, what, where, when, why, how).

19B7A52CE0A4417F9F429CE5C4D611F2.description: Use frequently occurring prepositions (e.g., during, beyond, toward).

16FA19B265D4423B913AC7B12029E116.description: Use frequently occurring conjunctions (e.g., and, but, or, so, because).

26622AAA779E48F2BA95AD51249E186B.description: Use frequently occurring nouns and verbs.

3B854CD276D04F8289D17CAE94C4E8C9.description: Use verbs to convey a sense of past, present, and future (e.g., Yesterday I walked home; Today I walk home; Tomorrow I will walk home).

AE40AEA1035A4C5AAA9DA1CBFE325631.description: Use personal, possessive, and indefinite pronouns (e.g., I, me, my; they, them, their; anyone, everything).

2FAF0FBDB0944411917512D7A1B3F6A3.description: Use singular and plural nouns with matching verbs in basic sentences (e.g., He hops; We hop).

EDC5B4A10D2D4A1EBB95BD6F30433C41.description: Use common, proper, and possessive nouns.

25C96B5C0AC94F5D9F980207E437ED8C.description: Print all upper- and lowercase letters.

AEC0FFEA0014483387C6BF745D2D617E.description: Demonstrate command of the conventions of standard English grammar and usage when writing or speaking.

1BB68C23194D4D928B614181DF4C846F.description: CCR Anchor 1: Demonstrate command of the conventions of standard English grammar and usage when writing or speaking.

12CEA662C27C4361AB2DA0239A5C3CED.description: Produce complete sentences when appropriate to task and situation. (See Language standards 1 and 3.)

AE42CCEA2A1E44C2BCA8A7CC5E0AB197.description: Speak audibly and express thoughts, feelings, and ideas clearly.

A3E8D082187D40D097F42DA22BF35603.description: CCR Anchor 6: Adapt speech to a variety of contexts and communicative tasks, demonstrating command of formal English when indicated or appropriate.

151197A40B9C47418506501A514ED491.description: Describe people, places, things, and events with relevant details, expressing ideas and feelings clearly.

25E0AEAC24BB44208762B3E3269CAB36.description: CCR Anchor 4: Present information, findings, and supporting evidence such that listeners can follow the line of reasoning and the organization, development, and style are appropriate to task, purpose, and audience.

3075A3BE91D242B1A3AB7F90F09F3FB6.description: Ask and answer questions in order to seek help, get information, or clarify something that is not understood.

68653214672041F0B66852CCBF01D911.description: CCR Anchor 3: Evaluate a speaker’s point of view, reasoning, and use of evidence and rhetoric.

6E79CC2D696847CC90D34319FD4C1543.description: Confirm understanding of a text read aloud or information presented orally or through other media by asking and answering questions about key details and requesting clarification if something is not understood.

CD1ECD410C0443268B25FE3F6DE3E996.description: CCR Anchor 2: Integrate and evaluate information presented in diverse media and formats, including visually, quantitatively, and orally.

257A9586F3F34AE6B055763A63E12D34.description: Ask questions to clear up any confusion about the topics and texts under discussion.

48999117F52544489A8FB1642311AAD1.description: Build on others’ talk in conversations by responding to the comments of others through multiple exchanges.

AEBF8487C9FA41DEB5E870A1075A3BD3.description: Follow agreed-upon rules for discussions (e.g., listening to others with care, speaking one at a time about the topics and texts under discussion).

4121C3B0FDEC443A857C4610A653D211.description: Participate in collaborative conversations with diverse partners in small and larger groups.

F88033C579D145D3A531F68DF9946D87.description: CCR Anchor 1: Prepare for and participate effectively in a range of conversations and collaborations with diverse partners, building on others’ ideas and expressing their own clearly and persuasively.

5E89C98E79C94DB682A0AD44F744B324.description: With guidance and support, recall information from experiences or gather information from provided sources to answer a question.

0B1A0C31F63949E891E5F108E0DA66AD.description: CCR Anchor 8: Gather relevant information from multiple print and digital sources, assess the credibility and accuracy of each source, and integrate the information while avoiding plagiarism.

3C10C8440BF14F9392BAD77873F7A1AC.description: Participate in shared research and writing projects (e.g., explore a number of “how-to” books on a given topic and use them to write a sequence of instructions).

B0507F09624348DCAB5378EA358115F6.description: CCR Anchor 7: Conduct short as well as more sustained research projects based on focused questions, demonstrating understanding of the subject under investigation.

B1A9D467D07048F5BEF750526B724E6D.description: With guidance and support, use a variety of digital tools to produce and publish writing, including in collaboration with peers.

05479D591A1D45D0B21D351B07FB5D85.description: CCR Anchor 6: Use technology, including the Internet, to produce and publish writing and to interact and collaborate with others.

AD6D9F4F995348BA9CFB900514790CD6.description: With guidance and support focus on a topic, respond to questions and suggestions from peers, and add details to strengthen writing as needed.

84D08A7E03024D00AA3CD1EEBA6E9670.description: CCR Anchor 5: Develop and strengthen writing as needed by planning, revising, editing, rewriting, or trying a new approach.

1144DDB62CC247F28D206F9A81D99492.description: Write narratives in which they recount two or more appropriately sequenced events, include some details regarding what happened, use temporal words to signal event order, and provide some sense of closure.

38BB041F73D2485295D75DAE00652BB2.description:
CCR Anchor 3: Write narratives to develop real or imagined experiences or events using effective technique, well-chosen details and well-structured event
 
 
sequences.

07FEAF6E59CE4954A5B70FFF55A4748C.description: Write informative/explanatory texts in which they name a topic, supply some facts about the topic, and provide some sense of closure.

23C7E8C9B70E41A792AF8B080F2C5E44.description:
CCR Anchor 2: Write informative/explanatory texts to examine and convey complex ideas and information clearly and accurately through the effective selection,
 
 
organization, and analysis of content.

CEBCCAE7CDB54D45828D3BB0B426FB30.description: Identify basic similarities in and differences between two texts on the same topic (e.g., in illustrations, descriptions, or procedures).

977B69CA51A542AE9DB5D59D0B1A1861.description: CCR Anchor 9: Analyze how two or more texts address similar themes or topics in order to build knowledge or to compare the approaches the authors take.

DE586F7691FD4BDCBF70DA93983B4DD5.description: Identify the reasons an author gives to support points in a text.

71C7AC3DF4FC4EEA9341F9EA586926B8.description:
CCR Anchor 8: Delineate and evaluate the argument and specific claims in a text, including the validity of the reasoning as well as the relevance and sufficiency of
  
the evidence.

9D28108C203C4B61949AE1F058212A58.description: Use the illustrations and details in a text to describe its key ideas (e.g., maps, charts, photographs, political cartoons, etc.).

94E764DCBFBE440EA31383DC239ACC9B.description: CCR Anchor 7: Integrate and evaluate content presented in diverse media and formats, including visually and quantitatively, as well as in words.

20B3E11C265A4D23A7FDF5792B5FE3D6.description: Know and use various text features (e.g., headings, tables of contents, glossaries, electronic menus, icons) to locate key facts or information in a text.

082E3F0E57224F848B5B22845BCCCA80.description: CCR Anchor 5: Analyze the structure of texts, including how specific sentences, paragraphs, and larger portions of the text (e.g., a section, chapter, scene, or stanza) relate to each other and the whole.

A95F02162A0F4556B6CAE36C497CBD82.description: Ask and answer questions to help determine or clarify the meaning of words and phrases in a text.

BB93157483284751BF59A1A8BB6FAECE.description: CCR Anchor 4: Interpret words and phrases as they are used in a text, including determining technical, connotative, and figurative meanings, and analyze how specific word choices shape meaning or tone.

BE75A274D7AF49AC81F9E2737DAAF601.description: Describe the connection between two individuals, events, ideas, or pieces of information in a text.

C0A3B2C2BE2D44139DC9AE040D2E14FF.description: CCR Anchor 3: Analyze how and why individuals, events, and ideas develop and interact over the course of a text.

30C48BCA4D044B69897194916EFDAAFB.description: CCR Anchor 2: Determine central ideas or themes of a text and analyze their development; summarize the key supporting details and ideas.

316F5A7C30C24852B45AED80D24E3F84.description: Ask and answer questions about key details in a text.

90BDD9884619482BBCB3446AAA4E8737.description: CCR Anchor 1: Read closely to determine what the text says explicitly and to make logical inferences from it; cite specific textual evidence when writing or speaking to support conclusions drawn from the text.
